title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: But this was not a cocktail party. West Grange House, a Georgian house behind walls, stood in the middle of a large garden that had been transformed for the occasion. Long trestle tables, covered with white linen cloths, had been set up beneath the two large oak trees that stood mid-lawn.

title: The Lost Art of Gratitude
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She crossed the road at Church Hill and made her way along the road to the gateway of West Grange House. Peter was in the garden, bending over to examine something in a flower bed, and was alerted to the arrival of Isabel by the barking of his dog.

title: The Comfort of Saturdays
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The three of them, Peter, his wife Susie and Isabel had been walking along the Water of Leith together, having had lunch in the Dean Gallery, when Isabel had said something about not wanting to crowd Jamie. The Stevensons had asked them to dinner at West Grange House and she had been hesitant in her acceptance.

title: The Charming Quirks of Others
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The gate of West Grange House was open. Isabel, who had walked over from her house, looked up the gravelled drive and saw that Peter Stevenson's car was parked at the front door.

title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: West Grange House was a large square house, built in the late eighteenth century and painted

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Peter met her at the door of West Grange House.
